trans-unit.source: Represents the method that handles post-cache substitution.

The HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback delegate, in combination with the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse.WriteSubstitution%2A> method, is used for rendering post-cache content for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Substitution> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> controls.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Substitution> control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Substitution.MethodName%2A> property to specify the name of the callback method to invoke when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Substitution> control executes.
The callback method that you specify must be a static method on the page or on the user control that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Substitution> control.
The signature for the callback method must match the signature for an HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback delegate that takes an <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> parameter and returns a string.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control, rendering is independent of the page caching unless an event handler is provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator.AdCreated> event.
If no <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator.AdCreated> event handler is present, post-cache substitution is used to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> content.
